column5: Headed out with a friend and my dad this morning -- about 7am start.  Took 20 minutes or so trying to figure them out -- slow start...till my dad left his spoon flat on bottom for about 10 seconds to tie his shoe, then...    John picked up on this "do nothing approach", and a couple minutes later...    His fish was tagged, #5438...  I finally caught on...eventually    Angelic shot I thought...   We ended up with 7 fish, top 5 might've been 21-22lbs, no giants.  We were in by 10am...very nice day out there.  Good luck to those heading out tomorrow...go early, bite dies fast...
A little easier morning at the boat launch eh!  So once the ice comes, you gunna go ice fishing every Friday  morn?
Very easy, yes.  And yes, many Fridays weather and work permitting...
Can i be your Dad some time ? That looked like some real nice fishing out there today .....
I wish we didn't put the boat away already, I'd love to try my luck at jigging some smallies up.
May be you and i should dig my inboard out tonight and make it ready for a bunch of us ready who would like to go ,  to go out in the morning ...........
"no giants"...not by Simcoe standards I suppose....but some very nice fish indeed!
Nice fish!  Did you report the tagged fish?  If not, let me know and I'll give you a gentlemans contact info.

It was reported yes.  Single tag, 4.75lbs estimated, released.  Tag was yellow...sent the info to Wil Wegman I think...a friend passed it along.  Thanks for the offer!  Last year we caught a VERY large fish with 2 tags on it...nice to see the research going on!
